intro: Stylidium emarginatum, commonly known as the emarginate stickleback, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its small, tubular flowers that are typically green or yellowish in color. The plant has a rosette growth habit with fleshy, succulent leaves that help it retain moisture in arid environments. It produces small, sticky seeds that are dispersed by wind, aiding in its propagation across dry, rocky habitats. Stylidium emarginatum is often found in coastal and inland areas with well-drained soils.
